heading: Wednesday Night
text: Cloudy. Snow showers likely in the St. Lawrence Valley and Adirondacks, with 1 to 3 inches, and maybe a late-night squall; a rising chance of snow showers elsewhere north after midnight. Lows from the upper teens to mid 20s. Light winds in areas east of the Greens, becoming south 10 to 15 mph from the Green Mountains westward.

heading: Thursday
text: Partly to mostly cloudy. Snow showers likely with embedded squalls, tapering off north in the afternoon, but remaining likely in the south; a trace to 2 inches of snow, locally up to 3 inches. Valley temperatures falling into the teens north, and into the 20s in the south. West to northwest winds 10 to 20 mph and gusting to 35 mph.

heading: Thursday Night
text: Partly cloudy in the evening, then clearing and much colder. Lows 5 below to 5 above zero. Northwest winds 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 30 mph, decreasing after midnight.
